result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D Slate was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan of $50.00 per month to commence on July 1, 2016 and every month thereafter.
With huber and good time.  Sentence is to be consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

FTP Hearing September 27, 2016, for $543.00

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony D Slate
Current: 571 Cty Rd A, c/o Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 04-19-2016)
Prior: 295 S. Main St, Markesan, WI 53946 United States

2:36 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Zamzow recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Zamzow.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

-60 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence.
-Huber and good time.
-Court costs $268 & $100 & DNA $200.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan of $50.00 per month to commence on July 1, 2016 and every month thereafter.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court grants the defendant sentence credit of 1 day.  Sentence to commence on April 18, 2016 no later than 7:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:48 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference at 04-11-2016 08:30 am
State's
Telephone scheduling conference at 02-22-2016 08:45 am
Defendant's
By Atty Jeanne Zamzow
Telephone scheduling conference at 01-15-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.

1:09 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Statement by Atty Privat - will be representing the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Vanessa P.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Statement by defendant in regards to contact with his daughter.  Statement by the Court - will not order any placement schedule at this time.

Court adjourned at 1:12 p.m.
